text: Kim Seok-ju (; 1634 – September 20 1684) was a Confucian scholar, writer and politician of the Joseon Dynasty. He was the elder cousin of Queen Myeongseongwife of 18th king of Joseon Hyeonjong and paternal first cousin once removed of 19th king Sukjong. His penname was Shigam(식암, 息庵) and Chinese style name was Sabaek(사백, 斯百). == Books == * 'Shigamjip'(식암집, 息庵集) * 'Byeolgo'(별고) * 'Haedongsabu'(해동사부, 海東辭賦) * 'Shigamyugo'(식암유고, 息菴遺稿) * 'Haenggunsuji'(행군수지, 行軍須知) * 'Gomunbaekseon'(고문백선, 古文白選) * 'Hangujasu'(한구자수, 韓構字藪) * Chunsojajipseomun(춘소자집 서문, 春沼子集 序文) == Related pages == * Kim Yuk * Kim Ikhun * Song Siyeol * Song Jun-gil == References == == Cite web == * http://100.daum.net/encyclopedia/view.do?docid=b03g1658b * http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=31181 * http://koreandb.nate.com/history/people/detail?sn=9901 Category:1634 births Category:1684 deaths Category:Korean educators Category:Korean politicians Category:Korean autobiographers
title: Kim Seok-ju
